overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, primarily sharing research updates, publications, and job opportunities related to computational social science, disinformation, and information operations. LinkedIn has the highest follower count, while content on all platforms appears to generate moderate engagement. The majority of posts center on academic research and related career opportunities.

contentThemes.description: Sharing updates on research projects, publications, and new versions of tools.
Discussion and research related to disinformation, coordinated inauthentic behavior, and information operations.
Announcing job openings, postdoctoral positions, and research opportunities for students.
Announcements about upcoming presentations at conferences.

recommendations: Diversify content types to include visuals like images or short videos to capture more attention.
Engage more actively in conversations by asking questions and responding to comments to foster a community.
Use platform-specific hashtags to increase visibility and reach a wider audience interested in related topics.
Experiment with different posting times to identify when the audience is most active and receptive to content.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows a strong interest in research publications and opportunities for students. Increase content related to student opportunities.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon content has lower engagement compared to other platforms. Consider tailoring content specifically for this audience, or engage more frequently with other posts on the platform.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn generates the highest engagement, particularly regarding job announcements and grant awards. Continue prioritizing professional announcements and career-related content on this platform.
